ref: 8335 pūráyati ʻ fills ʼ ŚBr. [~ pāráyati2. -- &rcirclemacr Pa. pūrēti, Pk. pūrēi; Pr. -- pürü ʻ to hide ʼ (semant. cf. meaning ʻ bury ʼ below: scarcely with NTS xv 297 < puṭa -- ); Dm. pōr -- , pū˘r -- ʻ to fill ʼ; Gaw. pōri -- ʻ to fill ʼ, Mai. pūr -- , ky. pōr -- , Phal. pūr -- ; Sh. pŭróĭki̯ ʻ to fill, complete, load (a gun) ʼ; K. pūrun ʻ to fill ʼ; S. pūraṇu ʻ to close, bury ʼ; L. pūraṇ ʻ to fill a ditch, bury ʼ; P. pūrnā ʻ to fill ʼ; N. purnu ʻ to fill up, bury ʼ; A. puriba ʻ to satisfy, multiply ʼ; B. purā, porā ʻ to fill, become full ʼ; Or. pūribā ʻ to become full, be completed ʼ (ext. with -- ḍ -- ; puruṛibā ʻ to fill up a ditch ʼ); Mth. pū˘rab ʻ to fill, complete, be filled ʼ; OAw. pūraï ʻ fulfils ʼ; G. pū˘rvũ ʻ to fill, block, lock up, bury ʼ; M. purṇẽ ʻ to satisfy, bury ʼ; Ko. purtā ʻ buries ʼ; Si. puranavā ʻ to fill ʼ. -- Caus. Pa. pūrāpēti, P. purāuṇā; N. purāunu ʻ to complete ʼ, A. purāiba, B. purāna, Or. pūrāibā, Mth. purāeb; H. purānā ʻ to fill, finish ʼ; M. puraviṇẽ ʻ to supply to the full ʼ; Si. puravanavā ʻ to fill up ʼ. -- MIA. pass. *pūrīaï: Ku. puriṇo ʻ to form (of grain), granulate (of wounds), be completed ʼ (whence caus. puryoṇo ʻ to complete, finish ʼ, N. puryāunu).<-> See Add.
kcch. pūrṇū ʻ to plug (a leak) ʼ;
kcch. pūrṇū ʻ to plug (a leak) ʼ;

lang: or mald. Maldivian dialect of Sinhalese
ref: Md. furanī (absol. furi ʻ completely ʼ), caus. fōranī ʻ reaches, effects ʼ (or rather < †prapūrayati?).
